item.title: Sandrine add a quote by E.M. Forster
item.description: "We must be willing to let go of the life we have planned, so as to have the life that is waiting for us." -- E.M. Forster

item.title: Sandrine add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "Healthy citizens are the greatest asset any country can have." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Sandrine add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "For every minute you are angry you lose sixty seconds of happiness." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Sandrine add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Finish each day and be done with it. You have done what you could. Some blunders and absurdities no doubt crept in; forget them as soon as you can. Tomorrow is a new day. You shall begin it serenely and with too high a spirit to be encumbered with your old nonsense." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Sandrine add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Is it so bad, then, to be misunderstood? Pythagoras was misunderstood, and Socrates, and Jesus, and Luther, and Copernicus, and Galileo, and Newton, and every pure and wise spirit that ever took flesh. To be great is to be misunderstood." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Sandrine add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Do not be too timid and squeamish about your actions. All life is an experiment. The more experiments you make the better. What if they are a little coarse and you may get your coat soiled or torn? What if you do fail, and get fairly rolled in the dirt once or twice? Up again, you shall never be so afraid of a tumble." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Sandrine add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "When a resolute young fellow steps up to the great bully, the world, and takes him boldly by the beard, he is often surprised to find it comes off in his hand, and that it was only tied on to scare away the timid adventurers." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Sandrine add a quote by Hippocrates
item.description: "Let food be thy medicine and medicine be thy food." -- Hippocrates

item.title: Sandrine add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "We are always getting ready to live but never living." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Sandrine add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Sandrine add a quote by Carlos Castaneda
item.description: "We either make ourselves miserable, or we make ourselves strong. The amount of work is the same." -- Carlos Castaneda

item.title: Sandrine add a quote by Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
item.description: "Whatever you can do or dream you can, begin it. Boldness has genius, power and magic in it!" -- Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

item.title: Sandrine add a quote by Jon Kabat-Zinn
item.description: "You might be tempted to avoid the messiness of daily living for the tranquility of stillness and peacefulness. This of course would be an attachment to stillness, and like any strong attachment, it leads to delusion. It arrests development and short-circuits the cultivation of wisdom." -- Jon Kabat-Zinn

item.title: Sandrine add a quote by Kabat-Zinn
item.description: "You make problem, you have problem" -- Kabat-Zinn

item.title: Sandrine add a quote by Frederick Leboyer
item.description: "The one you confront in Yoga is yourself. All that is rigid and stiff in you, all that says 'No." -- Frederick Leboyer

item.title: Sandrine add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Sandrine add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "This is your life and its ending one moment at a time." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Sandrine add a quote by Countee Cullen
item.description: "There is no secret to success except hard work and getting something indefinable which we call 'the breaks." -- Countee Cullen
